text.0: as at mans service of the gods invoker thou son of strength dost sacrifice and worship.
text.1: so bring for us today all gods together bring willingly the willing gods o agni.
text.2: may agni radiant herald of the morning meet to be known accept our praise with favour.
text.3: dear to all life mid mortal men immortal our guest awake at dawn is jātavedas.
text.4: whose might the very heavens regard with wonder bright as the sun he clothes himself with lustre.
text.5: he who sends forth eternal purifier hath shattered een the ancient works of aśna.
text.6: thou art a singer son our feastcompanion agni at birth prepared his food and pathway.
text.7: therefore vouchsafe us strength o strengthbestower win like a king foes trouble not thy dwelling.
text.8: even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftnessand overtakes the nights as vāyu kingdoms.
text.9: may we oercome those who resist thine orders like a steed casting down the flying foemen.
text.10: like sūrya with his fulgent rays o agni thou overspreadest both the worlds with splendour.
text.11: decked with bright colour he dispels the darkness like auśija with clear flame swifily flying.
text.12: we have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams glow hear our great laud o agni.
text.13: the best men praise thee as the peer of indra in strength mid gods like viyu in thy bounty.
text.14: now agni on the tranquil paths of riches come to us for our weal save us from sorrow.
text.15: grant chiefs and bard this boon may we live happy with hero children through a hundred winters.
